definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: Each day I live, the grace you give.
sentences.chinese: 每天的生活，禰都賜下恩典。

sentences.english: Because our triune God is the God of all grace.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我們的三位一體神是充滿恩典的神。

sentences.english: Your reality is only spirit. Therefore you are in a state of grace forever.
sentences.chinese: 你的實相是純粹屬靈的，因此你永存於恩典之境。

sentences.english: The priest always preaches on grace to a large congregation.
sentences.chinese: 牧師經常向廣大會衆講關於恩典的道理。

sentences.english: It contains the whole gospel and the essence of the covenant of grace. It has been in great measure fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 應許中涵蓋了全本的福音，也蘊藏著恩典之約的精髓。

sentences.english: Smith you don't realize it's a privilege to practice giving presents to others.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯你不明白，行習給別人贈予是一種特別的恩典。

sentences.english: Sanctity is the second benefit of the covenant of grace and flows from justification.
sentences.chinese: 成聖是恩典之約的第二個恩惠，它源於稱義。

sentences.english: Let Thy goodness, like a fetter, Bind my wandering heart to Thee.
sentences.chinese: 我主，讓此恩典維繫流蕩的心歸你前。

sentences.english: What applications has the grace of God invoked in you?
sentences.chinese: 神的恩典在你身上激起的是什麼應用呢？

sentences.english: This grace hath brought me safe thus far, And grace will lead me home.
sentences.chinese: 靠主恩典，安全不怕，直到我歸父家。

sentences.english: Gora , in all his matchless grace.
sentences.chinese: 戈拉，你完全地在他無比的恩典裏面。

sentences.english: All good works must be ascribed to the grace of God in Christ.
sentences.chinese: 所有的善工都必須被歸在基督理神的恩典。

sentences.english: Our response to God's grace is gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 對神的恩典我們應存感謝的心。
恩典與信心是不可分的。

sentences.english: Science only bestows the grandest favour on those who concentrate on it.
sentences.chinese: 科學只把最高的恩典賜給專心致志地獻身於科學的人。

sentences.english: That sounds like grace and freedom.

definition: favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
